types.name: appRunnerServiceSource
types.description: The source artifact of an App Runner service

types.name: appRunnerServiceStatus
types.description: The current state of the App Runner service

types.name: awsFiletype
types.description: AWS filetype kind

types.name: cloudWatchLogsPresentation
types.description: Presentation mode used in a CloudWatch Logs operation

types.name: cloudWatchResourceType
types.description: CloudWatch Logs entity

types.name: duration
types.description: The duration of the operation in milliseconds

types.name: result
types.description: The result of the operation

types.name: component
types.description: The IDE or OS component used for the action. (Examples: S3 download to filesystem, S3 upload from editor, ...)

types.name: hasTextFilter
types.description: A text based filter was used

types.name: hasTimeFilter
types.description: A time based filter was used

types.name: lambdaPackageType
types.description: The Lambda Package type of the function

types.name: lambdaArchitecture
types.description: Lambda architecture identifier

types.name: serviceType
types.description: The name of the AWS service acted on. These values come from the AWS SDK. To find them in the JAVA SDK search for SERVICE_NAME in each service client, or look for serviceId in metadata in the service2.json

types.name: name
types.description: A generic name metadata

types.name: filenameExt
types.description: Filename extension (examples: .txt, .yml, .yaml, .asl.yaml, ...), or empty string if the filename does not contain dot (.) between two chars.

types.name: attempts
types.description: A generic number of attempts

types.name: version
types.description: A generic version metadata

types.name: variant
types.description: A generic variant metadata

types.name: credentialModification
types.description: The type of modification performed on the credentials

types.name: source
types.description: The source of the operation

types.name: reason
types.description: The reason for a metric or exception depending on context

types.name: url
types.description: The url associated with a metric

types.name: eventBridgeSchema
types.description: The name of the EventBridge Schema used in the operation

types.name: runtime
types.description: The lambda runtime

types.name: runtimeString
types.description: A free-text field to record runtimes that may be separate from Lambda runtimes

types.name: templateName
types.description: Generic name of a template

types.name: debug
types.description: If the action was run in debug mode or not

types.name: httpMethod
types.description: Any valid HTTP method (GET/HEAD/etc)

types.name: oldVersion
types.description: The old version of something. Useful when updating dependent resources.

types.name: update
types.description: If the operation was an update or not

types.name: schemaLanguage
types.description: Languages targeted by the schemas service

types.name: language
types.description: Language used for the project

types.name: workflowToken
types.description: A token used for flow metrics to link calls together

types.name: enabled
types.description: True if turned on, false if turned off

types.name: credentialSourceId
types.description: Where credentials are stored or retrieved from

types.name: credentialType
types.description: The type of credential that was selected

types.name: partitionId
types.description: The ID of the partition that was selected

types.name: initialDeploy
types.description: Whether or not the deploy targets a new destination (true) or an existing destination (false)

types.name: framework
types.description: Application framework being used

types.name: xrayEnabled
types.description: Whether or not AWS X-Ray is enabled

types.name: enhancedHealthEnabled
types.description: Whether or not Elastic Beanstalk enhanced health reporting and monitoring is being used

types.name: databaseEngine
types.description: The database engine used (mysql/postgres/redshift)

types.name: databaseCredentials
types.description: How the database credentials are being retrieved

types.name: sqsQueueType
types.description: The type of an SQS Queue

types.name: presigned
types.description: Whether or not it was a presigned request

types.name: platform
types.description: Language-specific identification. Examples: v4.6.1, netcoreapp3.1, nodejs12.x. Not AWS Lambda specific. Allows for additional details when other fields are opaque, such as the Lambda runtime value 'provided'.

types.name: insightsDialogOpenSource
types.description: Dialog open trigger source location

types.name: insightsQueryTimeType
types.description: User-selected time range type while starting an insights query

types.name: insightsQueryStringType
types.description: User-specified search string type while starting an insights query

types.name: ec2ConnectionType
types.description: Ways to connect to an EC2 Instance

types.name: ec2InstanceState
types.description: Actions that can affect an EC2 Instance state

types.name: ecsLaunchType
types.description: Infrastructure type used by ECS tasks and services

types.name: ecsExecuteCommandType
types.description: Type of execution selected while running the execute command

types.name: ecrDeploySource
types.description: The source content specified in the ECR deployment request

types.name: dynamoDbFetchType
types.description: The type of fetch being performed

types.name: dynamoDbIndexType
types.description: The type of index being hit for the query/scan operation

types.name: resourceType
types.description: The dynamic resource type being interacted with

types.name: dynamicResourceOperation
types.description: The dynamic resource operation being executed

types.name: experimentState
types.description: The experiment action taken action taken

types.name: experimentId
types.description: The id of the experiment being activated or deactivated

types.name: toolId
types.description: The tool being installed

types.name: successCount
types.description: The number of successful operations

types.name: failedCount
types.description: The number of failed operations

metrics.name: apigateway_copyUrl
metrics.description: Copying an API Gateway remote URL

metrics.name: apigateway_invokeLocal
metrics.description: Invoking one simulated API Gateway call using the SAM cli

metrics.name: apigateway_invokeRemote
metrics.description: Calling a remote API Gateway

metrics.name: apigateway_startLocalServer
metrics.description: Called when starting a local API Gateway server simulator with SAM. Only called when starting it for long running testing, not for single invokes

metrics.description: Open the service URL in a browser

metrics.name: apprunner_copyServiceUrl
metrics.description: Copy the service URL

metrics.description: Create an App Runner service

metrics.description: Pause a running App Runner service

metrics.description: Resume a paused App Runner service

metrics.description: Delete an App Runner service

metrics.description: Start a new deployment for an App Runner service

metrics.description: View the App Runner application logs (the logs for your running service)

metrics.name: apprunner_viewServiceLogs
metrics.description: View the App Runner service logs (the logs produced by App Runner)

metrics.description: Opens a url

metrics.name: aws_saveCredentials
metrics.description: Save credentials

metrics.name: aws_modifyCredentials
metrics.description: Modify credentials (e.g. Add, Edit, Delete)

metrics.name: aws_loadCredentials
metrics.description: Load credentials from a credential source

metrics.name: aws_createCredentials
metrics.description: Create a new credentials file

metrics.name: aws_injectCredentials
metrics.description: Inject selected AWS credentials into a third-party run (e.g. RunConfiguration)

metrics.name: aws_validateCredentials
metrics.description: Validate credentials when selecting new credentials

metrics.name: aws_help
metrics.description: Open docs for the extension

metrics.name: aws_helpQuickstart
metrics.description: Open the quickstart guide

metrics.name: aws_showExtensionSource
metrics.description: Open the repo for the extension

metrics.name: aws_refreshExplorer
metrics.description: Refresh the AWS explorer window

metrics.name: aws_expandExplorerNode
metrics.description: Expand a service root node in the AWS explorer window

metrics.name: aws_reportPluginIssue
metrics.description: Report an issue with the plugin

metrics.name: beanstalk_deploy
metrics.description: Called when deploying an application to Elastic Beanstalk

metrics.name: beanstalk_openApplication
metrics.description: Open a window to view the status of the Beanstalk Application

metrics.name: beanstalk_openEnvironment
metrics.description: Open a window to view the status of the Beanstalk Environment

metrics.name: cloudfront_openDistribution
metrics.description: Open a window to view the status of the CloudFront Distribution

metrics.name: cloudfront_openStreamingDistribution
metrics.description: Open a window to view the status of the CloudFront Streaming Distribution

metrics.name: cloudfront_openInvalidationRequest
metrics.description: Open a window to view the Cloudfront Invalidation requests

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_copyArn
metrics.description: Copy the ARN of a CloudWatch Logs entity

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_open
metrics.description: Open a CloudWatch Logs entity. ServiceType and source indicate where the request came from (example: while viewing an ECS container)

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_openGroup
metrics.description: Open the CloudWatch Logs group window. ServiceType indicates that it was opened from a different service (like directly from an ECS container) (Deprecated - use cloudwatchlogs_open)

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_openStream
metrics.description: Open a CloudWatch Logs stream in the window. ServiceType indicates that it was opened from a different service (like directly from an ECS container) (Deprecated - use cloudwatchlogs_open)

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_delete
metrics.description: Delete a CloudWatch Logs entity.

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_download
metrics.description: Download a CloudWatch Logs entity. Value indicates the final size of the formatted stream in bytes.

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_downloadStreamToFile
metrics.description: Download a stream to a file on disk. Value indicates the final size of the formatted stream. (Deprecated - use cloudwatchlogs_download)

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_openStreamInEditor
metrics.description: Download a stream to memory then open in an editor.

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_viewCurrentMessagesInEditor
metrics.description: Copy the currently open (possibly filtered) messages to an editor

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_wrapEvents
metrics.description: Word wrap events off/on

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_tailStream
metrics.description: Tail stream off/on

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_refresh
metrics.description: Refresh a CloudWatch Logs entity

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_refreshGroup
metrics.description: Refresh group is pressed (Deprecated, use cloudwatchlogs_refresh)

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_refreshStream
metrics.description: Refresh stream is pressed (Deprecated, use cloudwatchlogs_refresh)

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_filter
metrics.description: Filters a CloudWatch Logs entity.

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_searchStream
metrics.description: Called when a stream is searched

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_searchGroup
metrics.description: Called when a group is searched

metrics.name: cloudwatchlogs_showEventsAround
metrics.description: Show event around a time period in ms specified by Value

metrics.name: cloudformation_createProject
metrics.description: Called when creating a CloudFormation project

metrics.name: cloudformation_deploy
metrics.description: Called when deploying a CloudFormation template

metrics.name: cloudformation_open
metrics.description: Open a CloudFormation stack in the stack viewer

metrics.description: A repo is cloned from CodeCommit

metrics.name: codecommit_createRepo
metrics.description: A repo is created in CodeCommit

metrics.name: codecommit_setCredentials
metrics.description: A connection is established to CodeCommit to perform actions on repos

metrics.description: Open a DynamoDB table in the table browser

metrics.description: Fetch records from a DynamoDB table in the table browser

metrics.description: Called when ECS execute command is disabled

metrics.description: Called when the ECS execute command is run

metrics.name: ecr_copyRepositoryUri
metrics.description: Called when the user copies the repository uri from a node

metrics.name: ecr_copyTagUri
metrics.description: Called when the user copies the repository tag uri from a node. The tag uri is the repository uri + : + the tag name

metrics.name: ecr_createRepository
metrics.description: Called when creating a new ECR repository

metrics.name: ecr_deleteRepository
metrics.description: Called when deleting an existing ECR repository

metrics.name: ecr_deleteTags
metrics.description: Called when deleting a tag in an ECR repository. The operation is a batch operation by default, value represents the number of tags deleted.

metrics.name: ecr_deployImage
metrics.description: Called when deploying an image to ECR

metrics.description: Called when deploying a scheduled task to an ECS cluster

metrics.description: Called when deploying a service to an ECS cluster

metrics.name: ecs_deployTask
metrics.description: Called when deploying a task to an ECS cluster

metrics.name: ecs_publishWizard
metrics.description: Called when user completes the ECS publish wizard

metrics.name: ecs_openRepository
metrics.description: Open to view status of an ECS Repository

metrics.name: ecs_deleteService
metrics.description: Called when user deletes an ECS service

metrics.name: feedback_result
metrics.description: Called while submitting in-IDE feedback

metrics.name: file_editAwsFile
metrics.description: Use authoring features such as autocompletion, syntax checking, and highlighting, for AWS filetypes (CFN, SAM, etc.). Emit this _once_ per file-editing session for a given file. Ideally this is emitted only if authoring features are used, rather than merely opening or touching a file.

metrics.description: Called when creating a new database connection configuration to for a RDS database. In Datagrip we do not get this infromation if it is created directly, so this is only counts actions.

metrics.description: Called when getting IAM/SecretsManager credentials for a Redshift database. Value represents how long it takes in ms.

metrics.name: redshift_createConnectionConfiguration
metrics.description: Called when creating a new database connection configuration to for a Redshift database. In Datagrip we do not get this infromation if it is created directly, so this only counts actions.
